text: Masai Mara National Reserve Also called Maasi Mara Game Reserve, and other variations. is a National Park in Kenya, East Africa. It was established in 1948 as a wildlife sanctuary, and has been made larger since then. Masai Mara is a game reserve type of park, meant to protect the animals on the savannah of the Serengeti. It is named after the Maasi people, who are the traditional people of the area. Big as it is, the Masai Mara National Reserve is only a fraction of the Greater Mara Ecosystem. The Mara is effectively the northern continuation of the Serengeti National Park game reserve in Tanzania. == The Great Migration == This natural event is famous for involving a great population of large mammals. Huge numbers of herbivores migrate each year, followed by the big cats. The Grant's zebras, Thomson's gazelle, Blue wildebeest, Common elands, African buffalos, Masai giraffes, african bush elephants, and larger white rhinoceros, or Black rhinoceros, and others arrive to eat fresh grass after the rain, and later move on. Lions, leopards, East African cheetahs, follow, and also vultures and Spotted hyenas. hippos and Nile crocodiles are in the rivers. It is called The Great Migration. The Great Migration is one of the most impressive natural events worldwide. Taking part each year are some 1,300,000 Blue wildebeests, 500,000 Thomson's gazelles, 97,000 Topi, 18,000 eland, Thomson's gazelle, 400,000 and 200,000 Grant's zebras. These plant-eating migrants are followed along their annual, circular route by hungry predators, most notably hunting they killed lions leopards and spotted hyena.Guide for Africa More than 470 species of birds have been identified in the park, many of which are migrants. Almost 60 species are raptors (birds of prey).Mara Triangle birdlist Birds that call this area home for at least part of the year include: vultures, marabou storks, secretary birds, hornbills, crowned cranes, ostriches, long-crested Eagles, African pygmy-falcons and the lilac-breasted roller, which is the national bird of Kenya == References == Category:National parks in Africa Category:IUCN Category II Category:1948 establishments in Africa Category:Geography of Kenya
title: Masai Mara
